alert.note: Alert for Giles (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 9:55PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by unknown continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Giles. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated flooding due to runoff from earlier heavy rainfall. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cecil Branch, Stony Creek, Walker Creek, Little Walker Creek, Sugar Run, Little Stony Creek, Broad Hollow Creek, Wabash Creek, Kimberling Creek, Dry Branch and New River. Walker Creek at Bane has crested and was falling, but it will be a early Tuesday morning before the creek falls back below flood stage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pearisburg, Poplar Hill, Bane, White Gate and Kimballton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
